text: Babar spoke to his army. Takht-e-Babri () is a tourist destination in Kallar Kahar, Chakwal DistrictTehsil Municipal Administration in Punjab, Pakistan. It is located 25 kilometres southwest of Chakwal along the motorway. Takht-e- Babri is a flat stage and throne cut out of stone by the 1st Mughal Emperor King Babur to address his army while coming down from Kabul in the quest of the crown of Delhi. ==References== Category:Tourist attractions in Punjab, Pakistan Category:Babur Category:Chakwal District Category:Buildings and structures in Punjab, Pakistan
title: Takht-e-Babri
